titles.title: Fairness and Voluntary Arbitration Act of 1998
To amend chapter 1 of title 9 of the United States Code to permit each party to certain contracts to accept or reject arbitrations as a means of settling disputes under the contracts.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

bill.summary: 11/7/1997--Introduced. Fairness and Voluntary Arbitration Act of 1998 - Requires each party to a sales and service contract that provides for the use of arbitration in resolving controversies to have the option to reject arbitration as the means of settling a controversy. Requires the arbitrator, whenever arbitration is elected to settle a dispute under such a contract, to provide the parties with a written explanation of the factual and legal basis for the award.
